adjective.description: Relating to or denoting a case of nouns, pronouns, and adjectives (as in Latin and other inflected languages) used for the subject of a verb.
Of or appointed by nomination as distinct from election.

noun.description: A word in the nominative case.

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin nominativus relating to naming, translation of Greek onomastikē (ptōsis) naming (case).
